moves.1. Nc3 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 Ne4 4. Nxc6: Now my bishops have more freedom.
moves.13. exf4 a6 14. Rhe1 Bh6: This was to attack the pawn...
moves.15... Ke7 16. b3 b5 17. Kf1 bxa4 18. bxa: Now there is space down the b-file.
moves.18... Rhb8 19. a5 Bb5: I pin the remaining bishop down...
moves.21. a6 Rb6 22. a7 Rb7: I manage to stop the pawn...
moves.30... d4: I go for a promotion attempt...
moves.35. f4+ Ke4 36. Re6+ Kf5 37. Re5+ Kf6 38: ...and cover the pawn, lining up the king...
moves.39. Rxd2: ...but did my opponent do the right thing here?
moves.39... Rxd2+: Now I can move in for the kill
moves.40. Kh3 b4: This pawn has a clear run...

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do? II
